properties.headline: Flash Flood Watch issued February 11 at 11:34AM CST until February 13 at 6:00AM CST by NWS Nashville TN
properties.description:
...Moderate to Heavy Rainfall Expected Wednesday afternoon into
Wednesday Night...lasting across Cumberland Plateau Region
through Mid Morning Hours on Thursday...

.Total rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches with locally heavier
amounts possible on top of a very saturated ground will lead to
an increasing threat of flash flooding Wednesday afternoon into
Wednesday night and across the Cumberland Plateau Region through
the mid morning hours on Thursday.

The National Weather Service in Nashville has issued a

* Flash Flood Watch for a portion of Middle Tennessee, including
the following areas, Dickson, Houston, Humphreys, Montgomery,
and Stewart.

* From Wednesday afternoon through late Wednesday night

* Rainfall of 1 to 2 inches with locally higher amounts possible.

* Rain will move in Wednesday afternoon with heavier intense rain
bands moving in Wednesday evening, increasing the risk for flash
flooding. Already elevated levels on several area rivers,
creeks, and streams will worsen through the period.
properties.instruction:
A Flash Flood Watch means that conditions may develop that lead
to flash flooding. Flash flooding is a VERY DANGEROUS SITUATION.

You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action
should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.

NWSheadline: FLASH FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH LATE WEDNESDAY NIGHT
